mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter: Frances Parke Lewis Butler, to Elizabeth Bordley Gibson, Philadelphia, 1821 January 7
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Butler, Frances Parke Custis, 1799-1875
Lewis, Eleanor Parke Custis, 1779-1854
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Frances Parke Lewis writes that Major Vandeventer has brought letter & package -- Cousin George Calvert brought Mr. Lewis's wig -- her friends, the Misses Douglas return to New York soon -- she wishes time of Gibsons' & Camacs' visit would come -- mentions how much she misses Philadelphia and her friend -- Mother [Nelly] will write her recipes -- followed by a long postscript that begins on page 3, continuing to page 4 and ending on page 1. Nelly gives remedies for chilblains -- and writes her recipe for hoecakes, cooked by spoonfuls ""on a hoe or griddle (as we say in the South)."" Date on original appears ""[1821] 1820 Jan. 7"". Letter itself is dated 1820, but content makes clear it was written in 1821. Autograph letter signed, 4 pages, with integral cover, docketed ""Mrs. Lewis Jan. 1821,"" full black seal inscribed with all seeing eye & motto ""May it watch over you"", postmarked (obscure), watermark (JM).
